t: Psalm 38
Prayer of a Suffering Penitent.
A Psalm of David, for a memorial.
O*pn Lord,*s rebuke me not in Your wrath, And*ln chasten me not in Your burning anger.
For*ln Your arrows have sunk deep into me, And*ln Your hand has pressed down on me.
There*ln is no soundness in my flesh because of Your indignation; There*ln is no health in my bones because of my sin.
For*ln my iniquities are gone over my head; As*ln a heavy burden they weigh too much for me.
My*ln wounds grow foul and*i fester Because*ln of my folly.
I*ln am bent over and greatly bowed down; I*ln go mourning all day long.
For*ln my loins are filled with burning, And*ln there is no soundness in my flesh.
I*ln am benumbed and badly crushed; I*ln groan because of the agitation of my heart.
Lord,*ln all my desire is before You; And*ln my sighing is not hidden from You.
My*ln heart throbs, my strength fails me; And*ln the light of my eyes, even that has gone from me.
My*ln loved ones and my friends stand aloof from my plague; And*ln my kinsmen stand afar off.
Those*ln who seek my life lay snares for*i me;*i And*ln those who seek to injure me have threatened destruction, And*ln they devise treachery all day long.
But*ln I, like a deaf man, do not hear; And*ln I*i am*i like a mute man who does not open his mouth.
Yes,*ln I am like a man who does not hear, And*ln in whose mouth are no arguments.
For*ln I hope in You, O Lord;*s You*ln will answer, O Lord my God.
For*ln I said, “May they not rejoice over me, Who,*iln when my foot slips, would magnify themselves against me.”
For*ln I am ready to fall, And*ln my sorrow is continually before me.
For*ln I confess my iniquity; I*ln am full of anxiety because of my sin.
But*ln my enemies are vigorous and*i strong, And*ln many are those who hate me wrongfully.
And*ln those who repay evil for good, They*ln oppose me, because I follow what is good.
Do*ln not forsake me, O Lord;*s O*ln my God, do not be far from me!
Make*ln haste to help me, O*ln Lord, my salvation!
